dot_prod[source]

dot_prod(x, y)

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
x = 2.3 + 8j
y = 3.2 + 4.2j
print("The dot product of {} and {} is {}.".format(x,y,dot_prod(x,y)))

The dot product of (2.3+8j) and (3.2+4.2j) is 40.96.
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
assert dot_prod(x,y) == 40.96
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class ComplexNumber[source]

ComplexNumber(r=0, i=0)

Defining complex number

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
num1 = ComplexNumber(2,3)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
num1

2+3j
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
num1.get_data()

'2+3j'
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

ComplexNumber.get_data[source]

ComplexNumber.get_data()

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
num2 = ComplexNumber(2.4, 5.6)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
num2.get_data()

'2.4+5.6j'
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class sayHello[source]

sayHello(to)

Say hello to someone

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
o = sayHello('Charlie')
o.say()

'Say hello to Charlie'
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

sayHello.say[source]

sayHello.say()

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
def dagger(x,y):
    return ComplexNumber((x.real+y.real)*x.imag, (x.imag+y.imag)*y.real)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
l = 2.3+5j
m = 5.6+9j

print(dagger(l,m))

39.5+78.39999999999999j
{% endraw %}
